item.title: How to keep sensitive data in Python?
item.author: Han
item.description: How to keep config file? An app’s config is everything that is likely to vary between deploys (staging, production, developer environments, etc). This includes: Resource handles to the database, Memcached, and other backing services Credentials to external services such as Amazon S3 or Twitter Per-deploy values such as the canonical hostname for the deploy Apps sometimes store config as constants in the code. This is a violation of twelve-factor, which requires strict separation of config from code.
